languageSpecific.usageNotes: Common noun used for buildings where people live. Takes neuter article 'das'.

definitions.text: A building for human habitation, especially one that is a single-family dwelling

examples.text: Wir haben ein neues Haus gekauft.

definitions.text: A family or dynasty

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Common English noun. Can also be used as a verb meaning 'to provide shelter'.

definitions.text: A building for human habitation

examples.text: They bought a beautiful house in the countryside.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun in Spanish. Very common in everyday conversation.

definitions.text: Edificio para habitar

examples.text: Mi casa está cerca del parque.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Strong verb. Conjugates irregularly: läuft, lief, gelaufen. Commonly used for walking, running, and functioning.

definitions.text: To move at a speed faster than a walk by moving the feet in rapid succession

examples.text: Ich laufe jeden Morgen im Park.

definitions.text: To function or operate properly

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Irregular verb: run, ran, run. Multiple meanings including movement and operation.

definitions.text: To move swiftly on foot

examples.text: I run every morning before breakfast.

definitions.text: To operate or function

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular -ere verb. Commonly used in sports and everyday contexts.

definitions.text: Muoversi velocemente con le gambe

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Common adjective meaning beautiful or nice. Can be declined based on gender, case, and number.

definitions.text: Pleasing to the eye or mind; aesthetically attractive

examples.text: Wir hatten einen schönen Tag am Strand.
Die Aussicht von hier ist wirklich schön.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Highly versatile adjective used to describe aesthetic appeal in various contexts.

definitions.text: Pleasing the senses or mind aesthetically

examples.text: She wore a beautiful dress to the party.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Adjective that agrees in gender and number. Hermoso (masculine), hermosa (feminine).

definitions.text: Que tiene belleza

examples.text: Es un día hermoso para caminar.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Adjective with irregular forms: bel, bell', bella, bei, begli, belle depending on context.

definitions.text: Di aspetto gradevole

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Preposition that takes the dative case. Used to express accompaniment, means, or manner.

definitions.text: Accompanied by; in the company of

examples.text: Ich gehe mit meiner Schwester ins Kino.

definitions.text: By means of; using

examples.text: Er fährt mit dem Bus zur Arbeit.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Extremely common preposition with multiple uses including accompaniment, means, and possession.

definitions.text: Accompanied by; in the company of

examples.text: I'm going to the movies with my sister.

definitions.text: By means of; using

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Preposition that combines with 'mí' to form 'conmigo' and with 'ti' to form 'contigo'.

definitions.text: En compañía de

examples.text: Voy al cine con mi hermana.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Abstract feminine noun. Forms compound words like Meinungsfreiheit (freedom of speech), Pressefreiheit (press freedom).

definitions.text: The power or right to act, speak, or think as one wants without hindrance or restraint

examples.text: Die Freiheit der Meinungsäußerung ist ein Grundrecht.
Jeder Mensch hat das Recht auf Freiheit.
Die persönliche Freiheit ist sehr wichtig.

definitions.text: The state of not being imprisoned or enslaved

examples.text: Nach zehn Jahren erlangte er endlich seine Freiheit wieder.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Abstract noun with political, philosophical, and personal connotations. Often paired with 'liberty'.

definitions.text: The power or right to act, speak, or think freely

examples.text: Freedom of speech is a fundamental right.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Central concept in political and philosophical discourse.

definitions.text: Facultad de las personas para actuar según su propia voluntad

examples.text: La libertad de expresión es un derecho humano.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun with invariable plural form. Core value in Italian culture and law.

definitions.text: Condizione di chi può agire senza impedimenti

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Neuter noun. Essential element, used in many compound words. Plural: Wasser or Wässer (for different types).

definitions.text: A transparent, tasteless, odorless liquid that forms rivers, lakes, and seas

examples.text: Ich trinke jeden Tag zwei Liter Wasser.
Das Wasser im See ist sehr klar.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Essential noun. Can be countable when referring to types of water or servings.

definitions.text: A colorless, transparent, odorless liquid

examples.text: I drink eight glasses of water daily.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun but takes masculine article 'el' when stressed. El agua fría, las aguas.

definitions.text: Líquido transparente, inodoro e insípido

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Very common in daily conversation and essential for life.

definitions.text: Liquido trasparente, inodore e insapore

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Common adjective and adverb. Comparative: schneller, Superlative: am schnellsten.

definitions.text: Moving or capable of moving at high speed

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Adjective and adverb with irregular comparison: fast, faster, fastest.

definitions.text: Moving or capable of moving at high speed

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Adjective that agrees in gender and number. Rápido/rápida/rápidos/rápidas.

definitions.text: Que se mueve a gran velocidad

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Adjective with regular forms. Can be used as both adjective and adverb.

definitions.text: Che si muove con grande rapidità

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Neuter noun. Plural: Bücher. Forms many compounds like Lehrbuch, Tagebuch, Wörterbuch.

definitions.text: A written or printed work consisting of pages bound together

examples.text: Ich lese gerade ein interessantes Buch.
Sie hat mir ein Buch geschenkt.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Common noun. Can also be used as a verb meaning to reserve or make arrangements.

definitions.text: A written or printed work bound together

examples.text: She gave me a book for my birthday.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Very common in educational and literary contexts.

definitions.text: Conjunto de hojas impresas y encuadernadas

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Central to education and culture in Italian society.

definitions.text: Opera stampata e rilegata

examples.text: Sto leggendo un libro molto bello.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Abstract concept, used in many expressions and compounds like Zeitpunkt, Zeitraum, Freizeit.

definitions.text: The indefinite continued progress of existence and events in the past, present, and future

examples.text: Ich habe keine Zeit für Hobbys.
Hast du Zeit für einen Kaffee?

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Abstract noun with multiple meanings. Can be countable or uncountable.

definitions.text: The indefinite continued progress of existence

examples.text: I don't have time for hobbies.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Also used for weather (tiempo). Very versatile in Spanish.

definitions.text: Duración de las cosas sujetas a mudanza

examples.text: No tengo tiempo para ver televisión.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Also means weather. Central to many Italian expressions.

definitions.text: Successione illimitata di istanti

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Plural: Städte. Common in geography and urban planning contexts.

definitions.text: A large town; an urban area with a dense population

examples.text: Berlin ist die Hauptstadt von Deutschland.
Ich wohne in einer kleinen Stadt.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Common noun referring to large urban settlements. Plural: cities.

definitions.text: A large town with dense population

examples.text: New York is a big city.
I live in a small city.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Distinguished from pueblo (town) by size and importance.

definitions.text: Conjunto de edificios y calles con gran población

examples.text: Madrid es una ciudad muy grande.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Invariable plural. Central to Italian culture and history.

definitions.text: Centro abitato di notevole estensione

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular weak verb. Conjugates: arbeite, arbeitest, arbeitet. Past participle: gearbeitet.

definitions.text: To perform tasks or duties in exchange for payment or as a means of achieving something

examples.text: Wir arbeiten an einem neuen Projekt.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular verb. Can be used as noun and verb. Very common in professional contexts.

definitions.text: To be engaged in physical or mental activity

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular -ar verb. Essential in professional and economic contexts.

definitions.text: Realizar una actividad física o intelectual

examples.text: Trabajo en una empresa de tecnología.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular -are verb. Fundamental verb in professional and daily contexts.

definitions.text: Svolgere un'attività per guadagno

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Common adjective. Comparative: größer, Superlative: am größten. Declension varies by case.

definitions.text: Of considerable size, extent, or intensity
Tall in stature

examples.text: Er ist sehr groß für sein Alter.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Common adjective. Comparative: bigger, Superlative: biggest. Also 'large' or 'great'.

definitions.text: Of considerable size or extent

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Adjective that shortens to 'gran' before singular nouns. Number agreement required.

definitions.text: De tamaño superior al normal

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Adjective with regular forms. Can precede or follow the noun with slight meaning changes.

definitions.text: Di dimensioni notevoli

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Plural: Freunde. Feminine form: Freundin. Can mean friend or boyfriend depending on context.

definitions.text: A person with whom one has a bond of mutual affection

examples.text: Ich treffe mich heute mit einem Freund.

definitions.text: A male romantic partner

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Common noun. Can also be used as a verb in social media context. Gender-neutral term.

definitions.text: A person with whom one has a mutual bond of affection

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Feminine: amiga. Central to Spanish social culture.

definitions.text: Persona con quien se tiene amistad

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Feminine: amica. Very important in Italian social relationships.

definitions.text: Persona legata da affetto reciproco

examples.text: Lui è il mio migliore amico.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Strong verb. Conjugates irregularly: esse, isst, , gegessen. Basic human activity verb.

definitions.text: To consume food by taking it into the mouth and swallowing

examples.text: Wir essen um 18 Uhr zu Abend.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Irregular verb: eat, ate, eaten. Essential verb for describing consumption of food.

definitions.text: To put food into the mouth and swallow it

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular -er verb. Can also mean 'to have lunch' specifically in some contexts.

definitions.text: Ingerir alimento

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular -are verb. Central to Italian culture which places high value on food.

definitions.text: Ingerire cibo

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Astronomical body, also used metaphorically. Forms compounds like Sonnenschein, Sonnenenergie.

definitions.text: The star around which Earth orbits; the source of light and heat for planets in the solar system

examples.text: Im Sommer geht die Sonne später unter.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Common noun. Often capitalized when referring to Earth's sun specifically.

definitions.text: The star at the center of the solar system

examples.text: The sun is shining brightly today.
The sun rises in the east.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Important in weather descriptions and astronomy.

definitions.text: Estrella luminosa centro del sistema planetario

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Central to Italian culture and climate descriptions.

definitions.text: Stella al centro del sistema solare

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Art form combining vocal or instrumental sounds. No plural form typically used.

definitions.text: The art of arranging sounds in time to produce a composition of melody, harmony, rhythm, and timbre

examples.text: Er studiert Musik an der Universität.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Uncountable noun. Universal art form across all cultures.

examples.text: I love listening to classical music.

definitions.text: Arte de combinar sonidos de manera agradable

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Italy has rich musical heritage, especially opera.

definitions.text: Arte di combinare i suoni

definitions.text: A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle

definitions.text: To gain knowledge or skill by studying, practicing, or being taught

examples.text: Ich lerne Deutsch seit zwei Jahren.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular verb. Fundamental to education and personal development.

examples.text: I've been learning German for two years.

definitions.text: Adquirir conocimiento o habilidad

definitions.text: Acquisire conoscenza o abilità

examples.text: Kannst du bitte das Fenster öffnen?

examples.text: Can you please open the window?

definitions.text: Abertura en una pared para dar luz y ventilación

definitions.text: Apertura nel muro per far entrare luce

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Abstract concept with deep emotional significance. Related verb: lieben.

definitions.text: An intense feeling of deep affection or romantic attachment

examples.text: Die Liebe ist das stärkste Gefühl.
Sie hat die Liebe ihres Lebens gefunden.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Noun and verb. Universal human emotion, central to literature and culture.

definitions.text: An intense feeling of deep affection

examples.text: She found the love of her life.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Central theme in Spanish literature and culture.

definitions.text: Sentimiento intenso de afecto

examples.text: El amor es el sentimiento más fuerte.

examples.text: L'amore è il sentimento più forte.

definitions.text: Having lived or existed for only a short time; not old

examples.text: Die Pflanze ist noch zu jung.
Er sieht jünger aus als er ist.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Common adjective. Comparative: younger, Superlative: youngest.

definitions.text: Having lived for a short time; not old

examples.text: He looks younger than he is.

definitions.text: De poca edad

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Adjective with regular forms. Can also be used as a noun.

definitions.text: Di poca età

examples.text: In der Nacht ist es kalt.

definitions.text: Periodo di buio tra il tramonto e l'alba

definitions.text: A woody perennial plant with a single main stem or trunk growing to a considerable height

examples.text: There are many trees in the garden.

examples.text: Er hat mich nach dem Weg gefragt.

definitions.text: To request information by posing a question

examples.text: Ich habe nicht genug Geld dabei.

definitions.text: A medium of exchange in the form of coins and notes

examples.text: I don't have enough money with me.

definitions.text: Medio de intercambio en forma de monedas y billetes

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Also 'soldi' in colloquial speech. Central to economy.

definitions.text: Mezzo di scambio in forma di monete e banconote

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Common countable noun. Essential in modern technology and workplace.

definitions.text: An electronic device for storing and processing data, typically in binary form

examples.text: I use my computer for work every day.
The computer crashed during the presentation.
She bought a new computer for school.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Borrowed from English. Also called 'Rechner' in German.

definitions.text: Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment

definitions.text: Froh und zufrieden

examples.text: Sie sieht heute sehr glücklich aus.

definitions.text: Che prova gioia e soddisfazione

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular verb. Can also be used as a noun. British spelling: travelling, American: traveling.

definitions.text: To make a journey, typically of some length or abroad

examples.text: I love to travel to new countries.
We plan to travel across Europe next summer.

definitions.text: Eine Fahrt oder Reise unternehmen

examples.text: Ich reise gerne in neue Länder.

examples.text: Me encanta viajar a países nuevos.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable noun. Geographical feature, often used metaphorically for challenges.

definitions.text: A large natural elevation of the earth's surface rising abruptly from the surrounding level

examples.text: Mount Everest is the highest mountain in the world.
We climbed the mountain in five hours.
The view from the mountain was breathtaking.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Plural: Berge. Very important in German-speaking Alpine regions.

examples.text: Abbiamo scalato la montagna in cinque ore.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Irregular verb: speak, spoke, spoken. Essential communication verb.

examples.text: Can you speak more slowly, please?
I need to speak with the manager.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Strong verb: spreche, sprichst, spricht, sprach, gesprochen. Essential communication verb.

definitions.text: Sich mündlich äußern, kommunizieren

examples.text: Ella habla tres idiomas con fluidez.

examples.text: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean on Earth.
We sailed across the Atlantic Ocean.
The ocean was calm and beautiful.

definitions.text: Sehr große Wasserfläche auf der Erde

examples.text: Der Pazifische Ozean ist der größte Ozean.

examples.text: El océano Pacífico es el más grande.

examples.text: L'oceano Pacifico è il più grande.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular verb. Essential in creative, business, and technical contexts.

definitions.text: To bring something into existence; to make or produce something new

examples.text: The company plans to create new jobs.
She created a wonderful atmosphere at the party.

definitions.text: Dare vita a qualcosa di nuovo

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable noun. Medical facility, essential vocabulary for health contexts.

definitions.text: An institution providing medical and surgical treatment and nursing care for sick or injured people

examples.text: She was taken to the hospital after the accident.
He works as a doctor at the local hospital.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Neuter noun. Compound word: Kranken (sick) + Haus (house). Also 'Klinik' for clinic.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Same spelling as English. Essential healthcare vocabulary.

definitions.text: Establecimiento destinado al diagnóstico y tratamiento de enfermos

examples.text: La llevaron al hospital después del accidente.

definitions.text: Struttura sanitaria per la cura dei malati

examples.text: È stata portata all'ospedale dopo l'incidente.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable noun. Can also be used as a verb meaning to cultivate a garden.

definitions.text: A piece of ground adjoining a house, used for growing flowers, vegetables, or herbs

examples.text: She spends hours working in her garden.
The garden is full of beautiful roses.
They grow vegetables in their back garden.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Very important in German culture. Compound: Kindergarten (children's garden).

definitions.text: Gestaltetes Stück Land zum Anbau von Pflanzen

examples.text: Der Garten ist voller schöner Rosen.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Important in Spanish culture and architecture.

examples.text: El jardín está lleno de rosas hermosas.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Italy is famous for its beautiful historical gardens.

examples.text: Il giardino è pieno di belle rose.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable noun. Gender-neutral term for someone engaged in study.

examples.text: She is a medical student at Harvard University.

He was an excellent student in high school.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable noun. Also used as a verb (irregular: dream/dreamt/dreamt or dreamed).

examples.text: I had a strange dream last night.
Her dream is to become a doctor.
Dreams often reflect our subconscious thoughts.

examples.text: Ho fatto un sogno strano ieri notte.

examples.text: Die Küche ist sehr modern eingerichtet.
Ich koche gerne in meiner Küche.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable noun. Central room in most homes for food preparation.

definitions.text: A room where food is prepared and cooked

examples.text: I love cooking in my kitchen.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Also means 'stove' or 'cuisine' depending on context.

definitions.text: Habitación donde se prepara la comida

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Italian cuisine is world-famous, so this word is culturally significant.

definitions.text: Stanza dove si prepara il cibo

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable noun. Also used as verb meaning to connect or span.

definitions.text: A structure carrying a road, path, or railway across a river, valley, or other obstacle

examples.text: The Golden Gate Bridge is in San Francisco.
We walked across the old wooden bridge.
The bridge connects the two sides of the city.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Plural: Brücken. Important infrastructure element.

definitions.text: Bauwerk zum Überqueren von Hindernissen

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Important infrastructure vocabulary.

definitions.text: Construcción sobre un río o depresión del terreno

examples.text: El puente conecta las dos ciudades.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Italy has many famous historical bridges.

definitions.text: Costruzione per attraversare un fiume o una valle

examples.text: Il ponte collega le due rive del fiume.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. No typical plural. Weather phenomenon, also used as verb 'regnen'.

definitions.text: Water falling in drops from clouds in the sky

examples.text: Bei Regen bleiben wir zu Hause.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Uncountable noun. Also used as verb. Essential weather vocabulary.

definitions.text: Water falling from clouds in drops

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Essential weather term in Spanish-speaking regions.

definitions.text: Agua que cae de las nubes

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Common weather phenomenon in Italy.

definitions.text: Acqua che cade dalle nuvole

examples.text: La pioggia si è finalmente fermata.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular verb. Common in social and cultural contexts for marking special occasions.

definitions.text: To acknowledge a significant or happy day or event with a social gathering or enjoyable activity

examples.text: We will celebrate her birthday tomorrow.
They celebrated their anniversary in Paris.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular weak verb. Essential verb for social occasions and holidays.

definitions.text: Ein Fest oder Ereignis begehen

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular -ar verb. Very important in Spanish culture which has many celebrations.

definitions.text: Conmemorar una fecha o acontecimiento con actos festivos

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular -are verb. Italy has rich tradition of celebrations and festivals.

definitions.text: Festeggiare un evento importante

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Plural: Flüsse (with umlaut). Important geographical feature.

definitions.text: A large natural stream of water flowing in a channel to the sea, a lake, or another river

examples.text: Der Fluss fließt durch die Stadt.
Der Rhein ist ein wichtiger Fluss in Europa.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable noun. Major geographical feature and water source.

definitions.text: A large natural stream of water

examples.text: The river flows through the city.
The Rhine is an important river in Europe.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Essential geographical term in Spanish.

definitions.text: Corriente natural de agua que fluye continuamente

examples.text: El río fluye a través de la ciudad.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Italy has important rivers like Po, Arno, and Tiber.

definitions.text: Corso d'acqua naturale che scorre verso il mare

examples.text: Il fiume scorre attraverso la città.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable/uncountable noun. First meal of the day. Can also be used as verb.

definitions.text: The first meal eaten in the morning

examples.text: I always eat breakfast before work.
What did you have for breakfast?
Breakfast is the most important meal of the day.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Neuter noun. Compound word: früh (early) + Stück (piece). Related verb: frühstücken.

definitions.text: Erste Mahlzeit des Tages

examples.text: Ich esse immer Frühstück vor der Arbeit.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Related verb: desayunar. Important meal in Spanish culture.

definitions.text: Primera comida del día

examples.text: Siempre como desayuno antes del trabajo.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Italian breakfast often includes cappuccino and cornetto.

definitions.text: Primo pasto della giornata

examples.text: Faccio sempre colazione prima del lavoro.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Plural: Wolken. Weather and sky phenomenon.

definitions.text: A visible mass of condensed water vapor floating in the atmosphere

examples.text: Keine einzige Wolke war am Himmel.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable noun. Also used in computing (cloud storage, cloud computing).

definitions.text: A visible mass of water vapor in the sky

examples.text: There are many clouds in the sky.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Essential weather vocabulary in Spanish.

definitions.text: Masa de vapor de agua suspendida en la atmósfera

examples.text: Hay muchas nubes en el cielo.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Common in weather descriptions and poetry.

definitions.text: Massa di vapore acqueo sospesa nell'atmosfera

examples.text: Ci sono molte nuvole nel cielo.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable/uncountable noun. Also used as verb. Related to physical activity and practice.

definitions.text: Activity requiring physical effort, carried out to sustain or improve health and fitness

examples.text: Regular exercise is important for good health.
What kind of exercise do you prefer?

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. For physical exercise, also 'Sport' or 'Training'. Related verb: üben.

definitions.text: Körperliche Aktivität zur Fitness oder Praktik einer Fertigkeit

examples.text: Regelmäßige Übung ist wichtig für die Gesundheit.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Essential for health and fitness vocabulary.

definitions.text: Actividad física para mantener o mejorar la salud

examples.text: El ejercicio regular es importante para la salud.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Used for physical exercise and practice of skills.

definitions.text: Attività fisica per mantenersi in forma

examples.text: L'esercizio regolare è importante per la salute.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Essential coastal and vacation vocabulary in Spanish-speaking countries.

definitions.text: A pebbly or sandy shore, especially by the ocean between high and low water marks

examples.text: Vamos a la playa este fin de semana.
La playa está llena de turistas en verano.
Me encanta caminar por la playa al atardecer.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable noun. Popular vacation destination and coastal feature.

definitions.text: A sandy or pebbly shore by the sea

examples.text: We're going to the beach this weekend.
I love walking on the beach at sunset.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Plural: Strände. Popular vacation destination in German culture.

definitions.text: Sandiger oder kiesiger Uferbereich am Meer

examples.text: Wir fahren am Wochenende an den Strand.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Italy has beautiful beaches along its long coastline.

definitions.text: Zona costiera sabbiosa o ciottolosa

examples.text: Andiamo in spiaggia questo fine settimana.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Central concept in Italian culture. Family is extremely important in Italian society.

definitions.text: A group consisting of parents and children living together in a household

examples.text: La famiglia è molto importante nella cultura italiana.
Domenica pranziamo con tutta la famiglia.
La mia famiglia vive a Roma.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable noun. Can refer to nuclear or extended family. Fundamental social unit.

definitions.text: A group of people related by blood or marriage

examples.text: Family is very important in Italian culture.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Central social unit in German society. Related terms include Verwandtschaft.

definitions.text: Gruppe von verwandten Personen

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Feminine noun. Core value in Hispanic culture. Extended family often very close.

definitions.text: Grupo de personas emparentadas

examples.text: La familia es muy importante en la cultura italiana.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular -ar verb. Essential verb in Spanish culture which has rich dancing traditions.

definitions.text: To move rhythmically to music, typically following a set sequence of steps

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular verb. Can also be used as noun. Universal form of expression and entertainment.

definitions.text: To move rhythmically to music

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular weak verb. Germany has strong tradition of ballroom dancing and folk dances.

definitions.text: Sich rhythmisch zur Musik bewegen

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Regular -are verb. Italy has rich tradition of classical and folk dancing.

definitions.text: Muoversi a ritmo di musica

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Italy is world-famous for wine production. Central to Italian cuisine and culture.

definitions.text: An alcoholic drink made from fermented grape juice

examples.text: Il vino italiano è famoso in tutto il mondo.
Prendiamo un bicchiere di vino rosso?
Questo vino ha un sapore eccellente.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable/uncountable noun. Can refer to type of wine or wine in general.

definitions.text: An alcoholic beverage made from fermented grapes

examples.text: Shall we have a glass of red wine?

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Germany also has strong wine-making tradition, especially white wines.

definitions.text: Alkoholisches Getränk aus vergorenem Traubensaft

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Spain is also major wine producer with regions like Rioja and Ribera del Duero.

definitions.text: Bebida alcohólica procedente de la fermentación de uvas

examples.text: El vino italiano es famoso en todo el mundo.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Markets are central to Spanish and Latin American culture and daily life.

definitions.text: A place where people regularly gather for the purchase and sale of provisions, livestock, and other goods

examples.text: Voy al mercado cada sábado por la mañana.
El mercado está lleno de frutas y verduras frescas.
En el mercado se pueden encontrar productos artesanales.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Countable noun. Can refer to physical marketplace or abstract market concept in economics.

definitions.text: A place where goods are bought and sold

examples.text: I go to the market every Saturday morning.
The market is full of fresh fruits and vegetables.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Weekly markets (Wochenmarkt) are common in German cities.

definitions.text: Ort zum Kauf und Verkauf von Waren

examples.text: Ich gehe jeden Samstag auf den Markt.

languageSpecific.usageNotes: Masculine noun. Italian markets are famous for fresh produce and local products.

definitions.text: Luogo dove si vendono e si comprano merci

examples.text: Vado al mercato ogni sabato mattina.
